title: Album Page, "Balcony Railing in Chapel, Château de Chenonceau, Chenonceaux", June 17, 1888
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, top right corner: 53; borrom right corner: 46; below balcony drawing, from left to right: hand rail; top moulding  / of base under / baluster; 4 M broad / bottom course; (written on ruled lines) Balcony Railing in Chapel; Chenonceaux / June 17th 1888; to right of balcony drawing (written perpendicular to drawing) height 1.30 about; below baluster sketch: This is a sketch of the baluster / but it does not look / anything like it - impossible / to get near it; to right of baluster sketch: not delicate / enough; to right of sketch on bottom half of sheet (perpendicular to drawing): scale = 1/10.
description: Vertical sheet illustrating a balcony, an example of one of its balusters, and profiles of three different moldings.  The balcony consists of three sections: a a balustrade of three balusters alternating with a short column with an engaged half-baluster; a row of alternating carved rectangular and blind vertical panels, and molding course below. There is a small semicircular projection of the balcony out from the center, below which are curved brackets and a small finial. The baluster is created by inverting two gadrooned vases, the upper smaller than the one below.  In the bottom half of the sheet is a scale drawing in graphite only, possibly illustrating short engaged columns with ornament.   This drawing seems to be perpendicular to the one above.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Balcony Railing in Chapel, Château de Chenonceau, Chenonceaux", June 17, 1888.Brush and watercolor, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-219.
